articles.author: Simon Lewis
articles.description: The United States is working to get an American citizen found on Thursday in Syria out of the country and bring him home, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said in Jordan, where he held meetings to discuss the political transition of Syria.
articles.title: US working to return US citizen from Syria, media identifies man as Timmerman

articles.author: Anthony Deutsch
articles.description: The United States sees the fall of Bashar al-Assad as an extraordinary chance to rid Syria "once and for all" of chemical weapons used by his regime to kill or injure thousands of people in its civil war, a senior U.S. official said on Thursday.
articles.title: US sees Assad's fall as chance to destroy Syria's chemical arsenal 'once and for all'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol on Thursday lashed out at his political opponents as "anti-state forces", said North Korea has hacked the country's elections and defended his short-lived martial law order as a legal move to protect democracy.
articles.title: South Korean President Yoon vows to 'fight to the end'

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Maya Gebeily, Tom Perry
articles.description: Rebel leader Ahmad al-Sharaa's Islamist group is stamping its authority on Syria's state with the same lightning speed that it seized the country, deploying police, installing an interim government and meeting foreign envoys - raising concerns over how inclusive Damascus' new rulers intend to be.
articles.title: Syrian rebel leader, after Assad's ouster, puts his own stamp on the state

articles.author: Maya Gebeily
articles.description: A hip bone in a blown-out building, part of a spine amid some debris, a few foot bones in a worn-out sock. The Tadamon district of Damascus is littered with bones, after what residents and rights groups described as years of killings there under the rule of Syria's Bashar al-Assad.
articles.title: At site of suspected mass killings, Syrians recall horrors, hope for answers

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: At least 35 Palestinians were killed early on Thursday in Israeli bombings of various areas in the Gaza Strip, the Palestinian news agency WAFA reported.
articles.title: Israeli strikes on Gaza kill 35 Palestinians on Thursday, Palestinian news agency reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three parties in the eastern German state of Thuringia joined forces on Thursday to keep the election-winning Alternative for Germany out of power, electing as state premier a conservative who led his party to second place behind the far-right AfD.
articles.title: Three parties combine to keep victorious far-right at bay in east German state

articles.author: Maayan Lubell, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israelis and Palestinians are signaling new efforts to forge a ceasefire deal, even a limited one, for the first time in a year that would pause the fighting in Gaza and return to Israel some of the hostages still held in the Palestinian enclave.
articles.title: Israel, Palestinians explore Gaza truce with US envoy on Mideast shuttle mission

articles.author: James Pomfret, Jessie Pang
articles.description: A Hong Kong court on Thursday convicted prominent former pro-democracy lawmaker Lam Cheuk-ting for rioting after he was attacked by a white-shirted mob in July 2019 at the height of that year's pro-democracy protests.
articles.title: Hong Kong ex democratic lawmaker convicted for rioting after 2019 mob attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Pakistani court indicted imprisoned former prime minister Imran Khan and his wife on fresh charges of illegally selling state gifts on Thursday, local broadcaster Geo reported.
articles.title: Pakistan ex-PM Imran Khan and wife indicted in another graft case, Geo TV reports
